Dave EpsteinMass. could see its first heat wave of the year this weekStarting Thursday, some parts of Massachusetts are likely to reach or exceed 90 degrees, setting up the opportunity for the first official heat wave.

Mass. reports 87 new coronavirus cases, 23 new deaths as key metrics continue to fallState officials reported Monday that the coronavirus death toll in Massachusetts had risen by 23 to 7,647 and that the number of people testing positive for the virus had climbed by 87 to 105,690, as four key metrics the state is monitoring during the reopening process continued to show the state is making progress in battling the outbreak.

Perspective | MagazineBill Russell’s hope for America: That this time will be differentI’ve been waiting my whole life for America to live up to its unfulfilled promise, Russell writes, because our lives depend on it.

JENÉE OSTERHELDTAmerica, what took you so long? As white America finally wakes up to the injustices, I have to know: Why did Black folk have to violently die over and over for you to see our humanity?

Perspective | MagazineBill Russell’s hope for America: That this time will be differentI’ve been waiting my whole life for America to live up to its unfulfilled promise, Russell writes, because our lives depend on it.

Perspective | MagazineBill Russell’s hope for America: That this time will be differentI’ve been waiting my whole life for America to live up to its unfulfilled promise, Russell writes, because our lives depend on it.

JENÉE OSTERHELDTAmerica, what took you so long? As white America finally wakes up to the injustices, I have to know: Why did Black folk have to violently die over and over for you to see our humanity?
